attributes.action: Reform the curriculum and fix the SEND crisis with urgent, cross-party action.
attributes.additional_details: Government and Parliament must urgently address the SEND crisis as councils face a projected multi-billion-pound High Needs deficit, with forecasts indicating a £6.3 billion shortfall as SEND funding becomes centralised. Without long-term, cross-party reform and sustainable investment, the system risks financial failure and continued unmet needs for children.
attributes.background: Government and Parliament should work together on long-term, cross-party reforms to address the SEND crisis, fund multi-billion deficits sustainably, and modernise the curriculum from EYFS to tertiary so it meets diverse needs and supports every learner effectively.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what SEND reforms or funding commitments you'd like the Government or Parliament to make.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what specific reforms you would like the Government or Parliament to introduce in relation to the SEND system.
